page.title: 10TENANTED LAND IN CLANFIELD
page.content: All five farm houses in the area,have in recent times been sold privately, together with small plots of adjoining land.This was done by the owner of South Leigh Estates, Sir Lynton White, to reduce the death duties.The land areas still owned by Southleigh Estates, (based at Havant)are rented by the farmers who reside in adjacent areas.There are three main types of agriculture practiced here:arable (cereal and root crops),dairy (though much reduced by E.E.C.restrictions) and on the high downland,sheep.The lynchet banks showing the ancient field system are still visible. South Leigh Estates are directly responsible for maintaining the woodland _ a mixture of deciduous and conifer trees grown on a commercial basis.
